cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating west-northwest across the eastern and central Caribbean, then forecast to slow, turn northwest, cross Hispaniola/Jamaica, Cuba, and eventually advance toward the Florida peninsula and the U.S. Southeast coast late in the 5-day period
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola near the Haiti/Dominican Republic border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches: Cuban provinces of Camaguey, Granma, Guantanamo, Holguin, Las Tunas, and Santiago de Cuba.  Tropical-storm watches posted for parts of the northern Dominican Republic, Saba, Sint Eustatius, Cayman Brac and Little Cayman.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings: Southern coast of Dominican Republic (Punta Palenque to the Haiti border), southern Haiti (Port-au-Prince westward), Jamaica.  Tropical-storm warnings along parts of northern Haiti and the south-eastern Dominican Republic coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern and central Caribbean islands today, Hispaniola late Saturday, Jamaica and eastern Cuba Sunday, then the Florida peninsula and U.S. Southeast coastline early- to mid-week.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts reaching South Jersey late next week; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected with present forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1–2 inches of remnant tropical rainfall around 8-9 July if the system tracks up the East Coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor marine/riverine flooding possible if remnant rain bands stall, but confidence is low at this range.
